intro: Astroloma cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf astroloma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Astroloma cuneifolium is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
